metadata.synopsis: Player and Astarion-companion get attacked by a group of vampire spawns during the night.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Vampire AmbushTake a long rest

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: You haven't spent much time with my family.

64.speaker: Leon
64.text: The master said to take our brother alive. Didn't say anything about you.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Listen to me, this ceremony is a mass sacrifice - Cazador is going to kill you all!

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: It wouldn't be the worst thing he's ever done to us. You know I'm right, sister.

96.speaker: Aurelia
96.text: Perhaps, but even if this is true, we're bound. We can't disobey him.

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: I can. I can stop him, but you have to tell me what you know.

145.speaker: Leon
145.text: Master said bring him home. Never forbade us from talking, though.

48.speaker: Aurelia
48.text: That's true. We can say whatever we like, once we're trying to take him back.

61.speaker: Leon
61.text: Sorry, brother, orders is orders. This is the best we can do.

93.speaker: Aurelia
93.text: Of course not, the master's no fool. He needs us.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: And when he doesn't need you anymore? What then, sister?

117.speaker: Aurelia
117.text: We have been his servants for centuries, he has always needed us!

82.speaker: Aurelia
82.text: And he needs you, Astarion. It's time to come home.

68.speaker: Astarion
68.text: What a mess. Well, at least you've met my family now.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I can't believe how you lied to them. You know they'll have to die for the Rite to happen.

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: What does it matter? There's only six of them. And they are vampire spawn.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You don't have sympathy for others sharing your plight?

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: No one ever looked out for me. No one ever said a kind thing to me.

142.speaker: Astarion
142.text: You're the only one. Other people don't have a heart like you. You're you. No one is like that.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: The world can be a wonderful, kind place, Astarion, when you find a home in it.

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: You say, as a mind flayer thrall who spends their life sorting out other people's problems.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: I'm doing this for you, too, you know. To make sure we're both safe. Forever, for good.

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: But... perhaps there's something in what you say.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: There are many others like me who will care for you, if you care for them.

163.speaker: Astarion
163.text: Ah, don't sell yourself so short.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I am rather special, aren't I?

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: We aren't like them. We are better.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Don't act haughty, you're only one tadpole away from being one of them.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: In turn, what does your life matter?

140.speaker: Player
140.text: We should try to save them, before it's too late.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: Why bother? They seem to like their torturer, now. What does it matter if they end up dead?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Even if they're misled, they're in danger.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: A few tendays ago, you too would've leapt at the hope that Cazador might free you.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Everything has changed. What matters now is that I can stand up to Cazador.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Had we killed them, Cazador wouldn't be able to complete the Rite.

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: He wouldn't throw away centuries of planning on a scrap like this. They were pulled back just in time.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Was it true what they said? That you gave up fighting him long ago?

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: You don't know what it was like. There was no way out.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Once - in the first decade of my slavery - I found a darling boy who I couldn't bear to bring back to him. So I ran, instead of hurting that sweet man.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: After Cazador caught me, the bastard sealed me, starving, inside a dusty tomb, all on my own, for an entire year.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: A year of silence. Months of scratching my hands raw, trying to carve my way out. More months of not moving at all. Months wishing only for death.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: So don't you ever judge me for doing what Cazador ordered.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I have no words. I'm so sorry.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: Nothing can make up for that. Not even Cazador's death.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: But to steal his life's work... that might be something.

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: No, he didn't. I am still here. And I will fight him until I fight my last.

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: And while repaying what he did to me is impossible, I am damn well going to steal that bastard's life work. I will become the Ascendant.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Still, you shouldn't have given up.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Easy to say the words, isn't it?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Move forward, and get your revenge.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: The way they contorted... they were compelled by Cazador, weren't they?

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: Yes. They cannot fight his compulsion. But I can, thanks to our wriggling friend.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Cazador's bond forced their hands against us - can he still force yours?

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: Ha! He cannot, thanks to our wriggling friend.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: He will be furious. And he'll be even more furious when I get to that crypt and stop him.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: For what it's worth, thank you. No matter what happens down there, you helped me stand up against him.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I hope we can get some rest now.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: You said they could take me? Really?

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: Ugh. Well, I suppose you knew we could defeat them. I'll try not to think what would have happened if we hadn't.

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: At least you've met my family now.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: And that was your gut response? Really?

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: I can't tell whether you're a bad liar or a worse jester, but either way, it isn't cute.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: Sorry, sweetheart, but consider our little love affair over. I don't want to be with anyone who has kidnapping fantasies about their partner.

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *You sleep, but the wicked don't. Someone is here to disturb your rest...*

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Get the hells away from me!
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion standing, facing the two vampire spawn that have sneaked into your camp

35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up from their bedroll where they've been meditating

120.speaker: Aurelia
120.text: Peace, brother. We're here to take you home.

138.speaker: Leon
138.text: The master needs all seven of us for the ceremony. Come with us and be reborn. We'll live again.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: What does Cazador want with him?

94.speaker: Aurelia
94.text: The Rite... The master needs him. He must attend.

172.speaker: Astarion
172.text: Oh, I'm well aware of what the master needs. But don't we deserve better?

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: After these centuries of torment, I know what you all want. More than power. More than to walk in the sun.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: You want to see him dead.

115.speaker: Astarion
115.text: The Rite of Profane Ascension will be mine, and he won't see a scrap of its glory. I am going to complete the ritual as the Ascendant, and then I am going to kill him.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: This is your chance. Stand with me. Name me your new master. We will get our revenge, and you will all live again.

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *His liar's smile spells danger. He knows full well that his kin will die in the ritual.*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *But if any of the bearers of the scar die before the ritual begins, he will lose his chance to perform the Rite himself.*

173.speaker: Narrator
173.text: *He needs them to run willingly to their deaths, thinking they stand a chance against their master.*

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Have you no heart, Astarion? You're asking them to die for you in this ritual.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: Don't look at me like that. With the sweet little 'disappointed I'm not getting cuddly Astarion' pout. I can't take it. I can't be what you want to see in me.
102.context: NodeContext: really does believe he went too far

114.speaker: Aurelia
114.text: 'Die' in the ritual? Whatsoever are you speaking of? We are going to cheat undeath.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: You're slaughter-lambs, all. Cazador needs your souls.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: We can save you. Let us help.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Come on, use your pretty heads. The ritual is a sacrifice.

139.speaker: Aurelia
139.text: The master doesn't need to lie to us. He controls us, fully. Why go through the trouble of giving us hope...

143.speaker: Leon
143.text: We're doomed. All right - what do you need from us? We'll help you...

132.speaker: Astarion
132.text: I'm doing what I have to... I can't be what you want to see in me.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: Don't spoil this for me. I almost had them -

106.speaker: Leon
106.text: Enough! Enough talk and enough lies.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: He's free of Cazador's command. You should follow him. He will save you.

1.speaker: Leon
1.text: You're free of him? Petras was right - you've changed. Maybe you could complete the ritual. Maybe you could free us.

180.speaker: Aurelia
180.text: Perhaps we can get back at Cazador, and finish the ritual. The seven can unite -

2.speaker: Leon
2.text: He is different - stronger, fire in his eyes.  Maybe he could take Cazador's place. Maybe he could free us.

86.speaker: Leon
86.text: Save us? That lickspittle only ever wanted to save himself - the rest of us be damned.

171.speaker: Leon
171.text: And now you think we'll throw away our chance at freedom? By bowing to you?

133.speaker: Leon
133.text: You were always weak, brother. We don't follow weak.

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: Why should we let Cazador have all the fun? After all he's done to us.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: Vengeance will taste sweet, paired with Ascension.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: You think he's ever kept a promise? He will never let us be free... You all know that.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Astarion has the strength to defeat Cazador. We should stand together.

141.speaker: Leon
141.text: Stand with the runt of the kennel? The one who always whimpered while he got beat?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: We are going to kill him, and anything that gets in our way.

80.speaker: Leon
80.text: Runt, we've spoken of vengeance time and again, and you never listened.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: What a lovely invitation, but I'm afraid I'll have to decline. I intend to kill him, you see?

162.speaker: Aurelia
162.text: We will live again, Astarion. The scars on our backs are sealed with the cruellest power. Seven spawn, seven sigils.

116.speaker: Leon
116.text: You're number seven - the final piece of the Rite. He needs us all for the Black Mass.

113.speaker: Aurelia
113.text: Our fates were sealed in his writing long ago. A promise to his favourite spawn, fulfilled in the crypt beneath his palace.

135.context: CinematicNodeContext: The spawn have a light glow come over them, begin to feel feral, Cazador's compulsion is coming over them.

63.speaker: Aurelia
63.text: The bond's hold. He owns us. We have no choice, we must obey. Get out of here, Astarion, before...
63.context: NodeContext: Last phrase is the moment Cazador takes control of them. They are giving Astarion a final warning to run away.

42.speaker: Aurelia
42.text: This is our only chance to be free, to end centuries of slavery. You will not ruin it, Astarion!

52.speaker: Aurelia
52.text: Master Cazador has known where Astarion was this entire time. He knew he would return.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Take him if you want, just keep it down. I'm trying to rest.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Thank you for your unerring support.

137.speaker: Aurelia
137.text: Much as we'd love to, the master's orders were very specific.

97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up from their bedroll where they've been sleeping

174.speaker: Astarion
174.text: This needs to end, one way or another.

134.speaker: Astarion
134.text: They mentioned my scars and a rite... I need to get to that crypt and find out what these damn markings are really for.
